head.title: World Briefing | Asia: India: Poor Vs. Rich At Climate Conference

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Asia: India: Poor Vs. Rich At Climate Conference

abstract.p: Indian Prime Min Atal Bihari Vajpayee addresses conference on global warming; underscores disparate financial ability of nations to limit gas emissions; states developing countries produce fraction of problem, yet will bear financial burden of coping with resulting environmental changes; photo (S)

block.p: Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee said that developing countries like India could not afford to substitute cleaner but more expensive energy sources for the fossil fuels that emit heat-trapping gases. Speaking in New Delhi at a conference on reducing global warming, he said that ''our per capita greenhouse gas emissions are only a fraction of the world average'' but that the developing countries would bear the financial burden of coping with the effects of climate changes caused by the gases. The speech highlighted the divide at the conference between richer and poorer nations over who should take responsibility for addressing the causes of global warming.
